result.execSummary:
The defendant Luis C Granados Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm AMENDED FROM Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
**AMENDED 10-5-2015:  To reflect that initial confinement is 1 year, 6 months and extended supervision is 2 years based on Truth in Sentencing.**
**AMENDED 10-1-2015:  To remove language that sentence is consecutive to contempt order.*
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: Current sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain GED or HSED while in WPS.  Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim, or the victim's mother, without prior agent approval.  Defendant may not have contact with his own children, or children under 18, without prior agent approval.  Comply with all Child Support orders.  No physical discipline with any children.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including parenting classes and anger management. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

supervisions.notes:
AMENDED 01-30-2017:  Length of extended supervision amended per decision and order filed Jan. 30, 2017.
Consecutive to: Current sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
